title: 'How Did Mahatma Gandhi Commit Suicide?', Exam Question In Gujarat School Shocks Students
text:
Did Mahatma Gandhi commit suicide or was he killed by Nathuram Godse? A question in a school exam has shocked Gujarat’s education authorities. Not just this, another question on illegal manufacturing and selling of alcohol in the dry state Gujarat, has also prompted the authorities to initiate an inquiry.

The question ‘Gandhijiye aapghaat karwa maate shu karyu?’ (How did Gandhiji commit suicide?) was the question that was asked in Gujarati to Class 9 students during an internal assessment examination of schools under the banner of ‘Sufalam Shala Vikas Sankul’, an official said.

Another question about the alcohol in an exam paper of Class 12 students was - ‘Writing a letter to district police chief complaining about the rise in sale of liquor in your area and nuisance created by bootleggers’.

Asianage.com

"A cluster of self-financed schools and those getting grants included these two questions for internal assessment exams held on Saturday. These questions are highly objectionable, and we have initiated an inquiry. Action will be taken after the report comes in," Gandhinagar's district education officer Bharat Vadher told PTI.

The question papers were set by the management of Sufalam Shala Vikas Sankul, and the state education department had nothing to do with the examination papers, Vadher added.

Gandhiji was assassinated by Nathuram Godse on January 30, 1948 in Birla House, which was a large mansion in New Delhi, now known as Gandhi Smriti.

If this was a trick question meant to confuse students, it might have worked a little too well because it has indeed shocked people across the country.
